properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy showers and thunderstorms crossing Lake Superior tonight. Showers and thunderstorms moving across the region may give local amounts of 20 to 40 millimeters tonight into early Wednesday morning. There is some uncertainty in the rainfall amounts predicted. A few locations may receive higher amounts and rainfall warnings may be needed. Impacts: Local flooding or washouts Reduced visibility while driving ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-15T16:14:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-15T00:24:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2146093137.2020
Area: White River - Dubreuilville, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park, Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay, Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southerly wind gusts will reach up to 100 kilometres per hour tonight. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-16T00:24:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-15T08:25:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0716424137.2020
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Patchy frost expected overnight tonight. Locations: Low lying inland areas along the west coast from St. George's to Gros Morne and the Great Northern Peninsula. Remarks: Light winds and clearing skies will create conditions favourable for the development of frost as temperatures in some areas dip as low as 2 C. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-16T05:24:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-15T13:25:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3147202135.2020
Area: Corner Brook and vicinity, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Northern Peninsula East, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada
